headline.main: Frequent Antibiotics May Make Children Fatter

docs.abstract: Children who take antibiotics gain more weight than those who don’t use the drugs in childhood, new research shows.
docs.snippet: Children who take antibiotics gain more weight than those who don’t use the drugs in childhood, new research shows.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Connecticut wrongful death lawsuit headed to trial takes up the issue of when a fetus can be considered a person for legal purposes, rekindling a debate normally heard in discussions about abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: The first nonhuman finding of cytomegalovirus could help scientists develop a vaccine to protect against the infection.

headline.main: Serious Human In Utero Infection Is Found in Rhesus Monkeys
headline.print_headline: Primates: A Human Fetal Infection Hits Rhesus Monkeys

docs.abstract: Study in journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences reports cytomegalovirus, infection transmitted from mother to fetus in pregnancy and often resulting in neurological impairment, has been found in rhesus monkeys; discovery marks first time virus has been found in nonhuman primate.
docs.snippet: The first nonhuman finding of cytomegalovirus could help scientists develop a vaccine to protect against the infection.

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Australia's hardline immigration policies overshadowed the launch of its bid to join the U.N. Human Rights Council on Monday, with the government and rights lawyers arguing bitterly over a pregnant Somali asylum-seeker who claims she was raped.

headline.main: Asylum Seeker's Rape Claims Overshadow Australia's Bid for U.N. Rights Body
headline.print_headline: Asylum Seeker's Rape Claims Overshadow Australia's Bid for U.N. Rights Body

docs.snippet: Australia's hardline immigration policies overshadowed the launch of its bid to join the U.N. Human Rights Council on Monday, with the government and rights lawyers arguing bitterly over a pregnant Somali asylum-seeker who claims she was raped.

docs.lead_paragraph: A lawyer for a pregnant Somalia refugee rape victim said Monday that he wanted to seek a court order keeping her in Australia before the government suddenly flew her to Nauru without providing the abortion she had requested.

headline.main: Lawyer Tried to Keep Somali Rape Victim in Australia
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Tried to Keep Somali Rape Victim in Australia

docs.snippet: A lawyer for a pregnant Somalia refugee rape victim said Monday that he wanted to seek a court order keeping her in Australia before the government suddenly flew her to Nauru without providing the abortion she had requested.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis canonized the Catholic Church's first married couple in modern times on Sunday, declaring the parents of the beloved St. Therese of Lisieux saints in their own right.

headline.main: Pope Canonizes First Married Couple in Modern Times
headline.print_headline: Pope Canonizes First Married Couple in Modern Times

docs.snippet: Pope Francis canonized the Catholic Church's first married couple in modern times on Sunday, declaring the parents of the beloved St. Therese of Lisieux saints in their own right.

docs.lead_paragraph: Living a life where secondary abstinence isn’t exactly a first choice.
docs.abstract: Ali Rachel Pearl Modern Love column shares how she has unwittingly become someone who is 'secondary abstaining,' defined as a sexually experienced person who has chosen to no longer be sexually active.
docs.snippet: Living a life where secondary abstinence isn’t exactly a first choice.
